metadata.title: CVE-2020-12695 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The Open Connectivity Foundation UPnP specification before 2020-04-17 doesnot forbid the acceptance of a subscription request with a delivery URL ona different network segment than the fully qualified event-subscriptionURL, aka the CallStranger issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 2:2.9-1ubuntu4.2
wpagui - 2:2.9-1ubuntu4.2
wpasupplicant - 2:2.9-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

gir1.2-gupnp-1.2 - 1.2.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libgupnp-1.2-0 - 1.2.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

minidlna - 1.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.9-1ubuntu4.2').
gupnp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
minidlna package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.20.04.1').
pupnp-1.8 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
